G.text:
Configuration for https://turbowarp.org/
You can move, resize, and minimize this comment, but don't edit it by hand. This comment can be deleted to remove the stored settings.
{"width":360} // _twconfig_

mutation.proccode: Set Page L %s T %s R %s B %s
Set Page L %s T %s R %s B %s

dr.text:
How to use text engine:
1) Keep "switch costume to (A)".
2) Change the "set size to ()" to whatever you want.
3) Go to the layer you want the engine to be on.
4) Keep the hide block.
5) Change the input in "Calculate Letter Sizes, gap: (-2)" to whatever you want, preferably a negative number no lower than -2.
6) Keep "broadcast (Clear Font)".
7) Change the first input in "Set Page L () T () R () B ()" to the left of your page in X. Set the second input to the top of your page in Y, the third is the right of your page in X, and the last input to the bottom of the page in Y.
8) Keep "Preset Y Position".
9) Remove all of the "Write (...) align (...)" and add however many back you want from the My Blocks. The first input is for what it writes and the second is the alignment; C for centered on the page, L for aligned to the left, R for aligned to the right, and anything else will be aligned to the left at X=0.
10) Comment on this project if you want to know how to do something else with this text engine, and I'll tel you if it's possible and if so, I'll tell you how.

                                                                    - FAQ -
Q: How to clear text?
A: Use "broadcast (Clear Font)".
                                                                 ---------------
Q: How to make text appear slower?
A: Right click on "Write Letter Feed" custom block and click edit. Turn off run with screen refresh. They should appear one by one. If you want them to appear slower, put a wait block after the "change i by 1" and set how long you want it to wait between placing letters. Thank you to @ORRKidd0 for this method.
                                                                 ---------------
Q: How to change gap between letters?
A: Change the input in "Calculate Letter Sizes, gap: ()".
                                                                 ---------------
Q: My text is disappearing when I write 15 or more characters!
A: You forgot "Calculate Letter Sizes, gap: ()". I suggest setting to -2.
